Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: We had a job fair in the middle of a heat wave and there was still a line going out of the door. We had another one when it was pouring rain, and the same thing happened.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Illustrating the high demand for jobs at the Tobyhanna Army Depot

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: We’re all about quality jobs, and that’s a quality organization.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: President and Chief Executive Officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Representing the interests of the local business community

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: It’s not $277 million that stays here. But, you know, it’s a good chunk of it. And it’s important that we keep that work coming.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Representing Scranton and Northeastern Pennsylvania, providing context on the economic impact of defense contracts

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: I don’t really think that people dwell or concentrate on anything that’s going on outside of their sphere of influence. We’re kind of busy concentrating on what’s going on in Scranton.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Providing insight into the local focus of plant workers

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: With the Ukraine support, you know, one day I was sitting there thinking about what needs to be done, and it kind of hit me that what we were doing directly affects whether people live or die.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Senior Technology Center Engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Highlighting the personal impact of working on Ukraine support efforts

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: At the height of last year’s counteroffensive, the Ukrainians were firing about 6,000 a day. The Russians are [firing] probably about 10,000 a day.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Senior Advisor at the Center for Strategic and International Studies
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Providing expert analysis on the Ukraine-Russia conflict

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Our first task is to save our people. Without artillery, we cannot do this.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Commander of a Ukrainian Artillery Unit
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Highlighting Ukraine’s reliance on artillery in the conflict

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The U.S. Army was making 14,000 artillery shells a month prior to the conflict. Now, officials at the plant told Morning Edition that the army is producing 36,000 shells a month, up from 24,000 just six months ago.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Providing official production numbers for artillery shells

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Biden administration announced this month it would be sending an additional $250 million dollars worth of new military aid to Ukraine, including air defense missiles and 155mm howitzer rounds.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Announcing official military aid to Ukraine

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Tobyhanna Army Depot, which specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine, estimates that the company has a $2.4 billion dollar impact on the area and that it is the largest industrial employer in the region.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Providing economic impact and employment information
